name: Vegan Crepes
description: Vegan crepes are not only super delicious but also really easy to make. And completely without eggs or milk. You can enjoy my vegan crepes with a sweet as well as with a savory filling.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups all-purpose flour or spelt flour
2 1/4 cups unsweetened oat, soy, or almond milk
2-3 tablespoons brown sugar or coconut sugar

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the dry ingredients in a medium-sized bowl. Melt the coconut oil in a small pot on the stovetop or in the microwave.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the dry ingredients in a medium-sized bowl. Melt the coconut oil in a small pot on the stovetop or in the microwave.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sparkling water, the plant-based milk, the coconut oil, the lemon juice, and the vanilla extract. If you want to eat your crepes with a savory filling, leave out the sugar and the vanilla extract.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the sparkling water, the plant-based milk, the coconut oil, the lemon juice, and the vanilla extract. If you want to eat your crepes with a savory filling, leave out the sugar and the vanilla extract.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir the batter well with a whisk until there are no lumps left.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir the batter well with a whisk until there are no lumps left.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some oil in a large non-stick pan (it should be only lightly oiled) and bake one crepe at a time. Use about 1/4 to 1/2 cup for each crepe depending on the size of your pan. Quickly swirl, so the batter covers the entire bottom of your pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Stack the ready crepes on a plate and put them in the oven at around 140 °F. This way they will keep warm until you're finished making all of the crepes.
